channel.title: CVE Feed for creativemindssolutions -- all
channel.description: The latest CVEs for creativemindssolutions -- all products

item.title: CVE-2023-30750|2024-08-02T14:37:15.579Z -- creativemindssolutions -- cm%20popup%20plugin%20for%20wordpress
item.description: Improper Neutralization of Special Elements used in an SQL Command ('SQL Injection') vulnerability in CreativeMindsSolutions CM Popup Plugin for WordPress.This issue affects CM Popup Plugin for WordPress: from n/a through 1.5.10.

item.title: CVE-2023-25992|2024-08-02T11:39:06.132Z -- creativemindssolutions -- cm%20answers
item.description: Auth. (admin+) Stored Cross-Site Scripting (XSS) vulnerability in CreativeMindsSolutions CM Answers plugin <= 3.1.9 versions.

item.title: CVE-2023-31228|2024-08-02T14:53:30.697Z -- creativemindssolutions -- cm%20on%20demand%20search%20and%20replace
item.description: Auth. (admin+) Stored Cross-Site Scripting (XSS) vulnerability in CreativeMindsSolutions CM On Demand Search And Replace plugin <= 1.3.0 versions.

item.title: CVE-2023-28749|2024-08-02T13:51:37.968Z -- creativemindssolutions -- cm%20on%20demand%20search%20and%20replace
item.description: Cross-Site Request Forgery (CSRF) vulnerability in CreativeMindsSolutions CM On Demand Search And Replace plugin <= 1.3.0 versions.

item.title: CVE-2024-4086|2024-08-01T20:33:51.657Z -- creativemindssolutions -- cm%20tooltip%20glossary
item.description: The CM Tooltip Glossary – Powerful Glossary Plugin plugin for WordPress is vulnerable to Cross-Site Request Forgery in all versions up to, and including, 4.2.11. This is due to missing or incorrect nonce validation when saving settings. This makes it possible for unauthenticated attackers to change the plugin's settings or reset them via a forged request granted they can trick a site administrator into performing an action such as clicking on a link.

item.title: CVE-2024-4086|2024-06-04T17:54:09.504Z -- creativemindssolutions -- cm%20tooltip%20glossary
item.description: The CM Tooltip Glossary – Powerful Glossary Plugin plugin for WordPress is vulnerable to Cross-Site Request Forgery in all versions up to, and including, 4.2.11. This is due to missing or incorrect nonce validation when saving settings. This makes it possible for unauthenticated attackers to change the plugin's settings or reset them via a forged request granted they can trick a site administrator into performing an action such as clicking on a link.
